title: PoA Geth 1.8.16 shows an error of out of memory
body:
We are working with multi node setup on Ethereum private chain PoA for enterprise. We have all three validator nodes.
```
blockchain    
├── genesis.json    
├── node1    
│   ├── geth    
│   ├── keystore    
│   ├── password.txt    
│   └── static-nodes.json    
├── node2    
│   ├── geth    
│   ├── keystore
│   ├── password.txt    
│   └── static-nodes.json    
└── node3    
    ├── geth    
    ├── keystore
    ├── password.txt    
    └── static-nodes.json  
```

Our private blockchain is integrated with the web application written in ASP.NET Core. To send request from web to blockchain, we're using NodeJs api as a middle layer, which forward the request from the web app to blockchain. Each are located on different server.

`Web App > API > Blockchain`

Use Case:
When a user register with the web app, it sends the request to the blockchain and create a wallet for it. The wallet address, private-key are stored in database for further use. Also system will send some ethers to each user from the coinbase account.

### Issue: 
While sending **multiple concurrent request** of user creation, geth consumes all the available memory and and the first validator node goes down. 

Code to create wallets from API

```
var accountObj = provider.web3.eth.accounts.create();
var pivatekey = accountObj.privateKey.substring(2);        

provider.web3.eth.accounts.encrypt(accountObj.privateKey, request.walletPassword);

await provider.web3.eth.personal.importRawKey(pivatekey, request.walletPassword);

if (accountObj.address != null) {
    await provider.web3.eth.sendTransaction({
        from: await account.coinbase(),
        to: accountObj.address,
        value: await provider.web3.utils.toWei(20, "ether")
    });
}
```

Validator node start script

```
GLOBAL_ARGS="--networkid 1616 --nodiscover --gasprice 0 --targetgaslimit 470000000000 --rpc --rpcaddr 0.0.0.0 --rpcapi admin,db,eth,debug,miner,net,shh,txpool,personal,web3 --mine --etherbase 0x8003E64D0ge1f0BdC02DCA6009Bc57Bb77Aa4F66 --minerthreads 1"

echo "Starting node1 ...!"

nohup /usr/bin/geth -datadir=$pwd  $GLOBAL_ARGS --keystore /home/ubuntu/blockchain/keystore/ --rpcport 8545 --port 30303 --identity "validator_node_1" --unlock "0x8003E64D0ge1f0BdC02DCA6009Bc57Bb77Aa4F66" --password /home/ubuntu/blockchain/node1/password.txt &

echo "Node started successfully, check logs in nohup file!"
```

What we have tried?

1. Tried to add cache parameter like --cache=1024

`free` result 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42034837/103129866-4e85f880-46c0-11eb-98c1-7322879953ac.png)
That's scrypt, used for encrypting the keystore. It's designed to use a lot.of memory, to make brute force attacks slow. You can use --lightkdf to set the mem requirements lower.
